Synopsis: 
Velasco Family (consisting of Leo, Alicia and her daughter Dafne, four years old) lives a quiet life in the city of Madrid. Alicia is usually the person responsible for the care and education of the girl, but during the Christmas holidays Alicia died unexpectedly after a seizure, leaving her husband alone with his daughter. 

Leo, conservative and homophobic man, cares for the small as best you can while Daphne, greatly affected by the absence of his mother, continually claim the mother figure. Leo, with the sole aim of seeking happiness of Daphne will be able to give also, fighting their own prejudices, to the point of losing their own identity. 

Production notes: 
Achero Manas, who managed to excite the public and critics with his debut film 'El Bola' and consolidated as a unique filmmaker in 'November' returns to film after eight years with a film of necessary and universal theme, as is the love of children and the slaughter capacity of parents, and reflects on the identity, changing roles in the modern family and its evolution.
